definition: to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc
a bow (weapon)/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to bend/to arch (one's back etc)

sentences.english: Practices show that smaller equivalent mass is better.
sentences.chinese: 实践证明，受电弓的等效质量越小越好。

sentences.english: Pantograph is one of the most important parts of urban rail vehicles.
sentences.chinese: 受电弓是城市轨道交通车辆的重要部件之一。

sentences.english: The pumping unit on our carriages are self contained and there are no hoses over the pantograph.
sentences.chinese: 锯座上的抽取装置为整装式，受电弓上没有软管。

sentences.english: Two shapes of guide way are designed.
sentences.chinese: 设计两种受电弓导轨外形。

sentences.english: The species and preparation methods of carbonic system pantograph strip materials are explained in detail.
sentences.chinese: 重点阐述了炭系受电弓滑板材料的种类和制备方法。

definition: intrusion/perimeter breach/(esp.) (of a person or a foreign object) to breach the perimeter surrounding railway tracks
